org.magelan.drawing
Interface DrawingRenderer

All Known Implementing Classes:
ColorRenderer, CompoundRenderer, CoreRenderer, DefaultDrawingRenderer, VariantRenderer
public interface DrawingRenderer

A renderer interface for drawing models and arbitrary drawing elements. It can be used to render an element and obtain information regarding its geometry. Note that the entities being rendered are not necessarily instances of DrawingElement. If they are, the renderer can invoke element's own rendering method and do supplementary rendering.

Version:
1.1, 04/2004
Author:
Assen Antov
See Also:
DrawingModel, DrawingElement

Method Detail

getShape

java.awt.Shape getShape(java.lang.Object element)
Used to obtain a Shape instance, representing the parameter element. The coordinates defining the Shape are in model space and are not scaled, rotated or transformed in any other way.

Parameters:
element - the element to process
Returns:
a Shape instance, representing the element

configure

void configure(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
               java.lang.Object element,
               DrawingModel model)
Configures the parameter graphics context with the proper color, stroke, paint and alpha for the element.

Parameters:
g - graphics context to configure
element - the element to configure the context for
model - the drawing model to get rendering information from (layers, colors, etc.)
Since:
1.1

paint

void paint(java.lang.Object element,
           java.awt.Graphics2D g,
           DrawingModel model)
A graphics renderer of the element. By convention this method will assume that the parameter graphics context is configured with the the proper transform and clipping shape. The method will take care for setting the color, stroke, paint and alpha for the element.

Parameters:
element - the element to render
g - graphics context to draw to
model - the drawing model to get rendering information from (layers, colors, etc.)

paint

void paint(DrawingModel model,
           java.awt.Graphics2D g)
Paints the drawing model to the parameter graphics context. By convention this method will assume that the parameter graphics context is configured with the the proper transform and clipping shape. The method will take care for setting the color, stroke, paint and alpha for each rendered element.

Parameters:
model - the drawing model to get rendering information from (layers, colors, etc.)
g - graphics context to draw to

paint

void paint(DrawingModel model,
           java.util.Collection exclude,
           java.awt.Graphics2D g)
Paints the drawing model to the parameter graphics context, exluding the elements contained in the parameter collection. By convention this method will assume that the parameter graphics context is configured with the the proper transform and clipping shape. The method will take care for setting the color, stroke, paint and alpha for each rendered element.

Parameters:
model - the drawing model to get rendering information from (layers, colors, etc.)
exclude - a collection of elements that should not be painted
g - graphics context to draw to
Since:
1.1

getExtents

java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D getExtents(DrawingModel model)
Calculates the bounding rectangle of the drawing (in model space coordinates), represented by the parameter drawing model, as it would be rendered.

Parameters:
model - the drawing model to analyze
Returns:
the drawing extents rectangle

getBounds

java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D getBounds(java.lang.Object element)
Calculates the bounding rectangle of the paramter drawing element (in model space coordinates). The resulting rectangle should be equal to the result of getShape(element).getBounds2D(). The method will attempt to avoid construction of element's shape, as this can be an expensive operation.

Parameters:
element - the element to process
Returns:
the bounding rectangle of element's shape
Since:
1.1
